list.s: It’s people like you who make it possible to give the priceless gift of “Second Sight”.
Many people send gifts of $35, $50, or even $100 or more — whatever you are able to give to help maintain this vital service.
So you are uniquely familiar with the behaviors of dinosaurs interacting with people.
The fact that they were never challenged, perhaps most people, and perhaps everybody felt there was no basis for challenging them.
You want the right to copy verbatim other people's books,don't you?

I mean, the reason that it's been prospective and retrospective is that people should be, people who hold copyrights should be subject to the same regime and not have some people who got their copyrights the week before the law passed treated differently than people who got it the week after.

A gut instinct that something is going to work. Somebody at AMC is greenlighting The Walking Dead based partly on historical evidence that says people like Zombies, but also partly on the notion that this particular iteration will have a new twist that will bring new people into the (zombie and AMC) tent.
